poem:
**Perseids**

Fire upon darkened sky –
August whispers
in shimmered fragments,
the moon
half-closed.
London blinks,
dotted streets below,
yet our eyes are north-east,
where heavens spill
silent miracles,
momentary sparks
in night's vast pause.

– William Carlos Williams
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Starwatch: Perseids to peak in dazzling shower mid-month It is the big one for meteor watchers. The annual Perseid meteor shower will reach its peak of activity on the night of 12 August going into the early hours of 13 August. The chart shows the view looking north-east from London at midnight. The moon will have 50% of its visible surface illuminated, and will be setting near midnight, leaving the sky as dark as possible". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
